Vault training
Modify the vault config to use the generated certificates

Now that we have our SSL certificate/key pair it's time to tell vault to use them to communicate over https. To do this modify /etc/vault.conf. Removing the tls_disable parameter and adding the parameters tls_cert_file and tls_key_file.

  • sudo vim /etc/vault.conf
  • Set the listener block to look like below
  • listener "tcp" {   address = "0.0.0.0:8200"   tls_key_file = "/etc/ssl/vault.key"   tls_cert_file = "/etc/ssl/vault.crt" }

As we will have to restart vault to pick up this config change it's probably a good time to also issue the rekey command so we have more than a single unseal key. In a production environment we would define a number of people to act as unseal key holders, we would use this number as the value for -key-shares. The -key-threshold defines the number of unseal keys needed to unseal vault. For the purpose of this tutorial we'll generate 5 unseal keys and require 2 to reconstruct the master key and unseal the vault.

  • vault rekey -key-shares=5 -key-threshold=2
  • Rekey operation nonce: 240be445-2480-b422-381e-089ea1fdf628 Key (will be hidden): Key 1: <UNSEAL KEY> Key 2: <UNSEAL KEY> Key 3: <UNSEAL KEY> Key 4: <UNSEAL KEY> Key 5: <UNSEAL KEY> Operation nonce: 240be445-2480-b422-381e-089ea1fdf628 Vault rekeyed with 5 keys and a key threshold of 2. Please securely distribute the above keys. When the vault is re-sealed, restarted, or stopped, you must provide at least 2 of these keys to unseal it again. Vault does not store the master key. Without at least 2 keys, your vault will remain permanently sealed.
  • sudo systemctl restart vault

The vault server will restart in a sealed state. In order for our vault client to communicate with the server we need to change VAULT_ADDR environment variable as it's still set to communicate with vault over http and we're now using https. Once this has been done you can issue the vault unseal command until vault is unsealed

  • sed -e '/VAULT_SKIP_VERIFY/d' -e 's/VAULT_ADDR="http:/VAULT_ADDR="https:/' -i ~/.bash_profile
  • source .bash_profile
  • vault unseal
  • Key (will be hidden): Sealed: true Key Shares: 5 Key Threshold: 2 Unseal Progress: 1 Unseal Nonce: 0f518f90-e63b-2d8a-fef9-b5e22502dd51
  • vault unseal
  • Key (will be hidden): Sealed: false Key Shares: 5 Key Threshold: 2 Unseal Progress: 0 Unseal Nonce:
